intro: Gnaphalium villarroeli, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to white flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It is typically found in alpine and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, high-altitude environments. Its foliage is usually covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance and aiding in water retention.
